Table.SCRIPT: The human heart needs to [{beat}] all the time so that air can get to a person’s brain. If someone’s heart stops beating or they stop breathing, you have four “golden minutes” to help them in this [{situation}]. First, call for an ambulance. Second, do chest [{compressions}]. Lie the person [{flat}] on their back and put both your hands on their chest. With one hand on top of the other, press the [{weight}] of your body down on their [{chest}] and release. You need to [{repeat}] this very quickly, about 100-120 times per minute. This can save someone’s life!
Table.TITLE: Golden Time that Saves Lives
